channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Albert S. Ruddy, 94, Dies; Producer Won an Oscar for ‘The Godfather’
item.description: A creator of the sitcom “Hogan’s Heroes,” he went on to win a second Academy Award for “Million Dollar Baby,” the boxing film starring Hilary Swank and Clint Eastwood.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israel’s Claim of Control Over Border Zone Risks Raising Tensions With Egypt
item.description: The two countries have butted heads over Israel’s military offensive in Rafah. Egypt has warned that if Israeli forces occupied the Philadelphi Corridor, it would pose a “serious threat” to relations.

item.title: How much you can make as an information security analyst in each state
item.description: Washington, New York, and Iowa pay top dollar for information security analysts—up to $148,000 in annual salary.

item.title: For Trump, ‘Guilty’ May Not Matter
item.description: The conviction may be a mere bump in the road. It could even be a political accelerant.

item.title: Biden to Allow Ukraine to Use U.S. Weapons to Strike Inside Russia
item.description: The permission is intended solely for Ukraine to attack military sites in Russia being used to attack the Kharkiv area, U.S. officials said.

item.title: New York jury finds Trump guilty on all 34 felony counts in hush-money trial
item.description: A New York jury found him guilty of falsifying business records in a scheme to illegally influence the 2016 election through hush money payments to porn actor Stormy Daniels.

item.title: Donald Trump, Felon
item.description: The former president’s conviction in a New York criminal trial revealed, yet again, why he is unfit for office.

item.title: Egypt Faces Hard Choices After Israeli Seizure of Gaza’s Southern Border
item.description: Egypt’s government is weighing its “cornerstone” relationship with Israel against the economic damage the war in Gaza is inflicting and against the domestic outrage over the devastation there.

item.title: Three Black men sue American Airlines, saying they were kicked off their flight after a random complaint about body odor
item.description: The lawsuit alleges that the men were ejected from the plane "without any valid reason, and solely based on their race."

item.title: Trump Can Sue Niece Over Disclosure of Financial Documents, Court Rules
item.description: The case concerns Mary L. Trump’s disclosure of financial documents to a team of reporters at The New York Times.

item.title: Taking the Fight to Russia: The West Weighs Ukraine’s Use of Its Weapons
item.description: More NATO allies are backing Kyiv’s pleas to allow its forces to conduct strikes in Russian territory with Western weapons.

item.title: Hopes of a 10-year EV transition are ‘irrational’ pipe dreams because we don’t have enough battery materials—opening up a single copper mine takes 23 years
item.description: An expected copper shortage and mining industry dynamics are threatening to stop the EV transition in its tracks.

item.title: How Trump’s Team Blew It
item.description: The defense failed to focus on the most important things.

item.title: Ukrainian Drone Strikes Target Russian Nuclear Radar Stations
item.description: A radar facility more than 1,100 miles into Russia was damaged, satellite imagery showed. The attacks have drawn concern from U.S. officials.

item.title: Alexander Wang dropped a wild ad featuring doppelgängers for Taylor Swift, Beyoncé, and Kylie Jenner—'this video is diabolical'
item.description: Among the TikTok stars featured are Paige Niemann, Taylor Madison, and Ashley Leechin, who resemble Ariana Grande, Kylie Jenner, and Taylor Swift.
